 16. We decide to use a SARIMA(0,0,0)(0,1,0)[24] model: which is equivalent to a seasonal random walk. 
     This model is: 
        y_t = y_{t-24} + e_t
     So the forecast for the next 24 hours would be the last 24 hours we have (i.e., the 4th day: 2016-10-16 00:00:00 to 2016-10-16 23:00:00).
     Then the next 24 hours (2016-10-17) would be the same as 2016-10-16, and then 2016-10-18 same as 2016-10-16?

        Day 6 (2016-10-18) = Day 3 (2016-10-15)  ???

     However, the model with (0,0,0)(0,1,0)[24] is a seasonal naive model: 
        Forecast for t+1 = value at t+1-24 (i.e., one day before at the same hour)

     But for the first 24 hours of the future (2016-10-17 00:00:00 to 2016-10-17 23:00:00), we would use the values from 2016-10-16 00:00:00 to 2016-10-16 23:00:00.

     Then for the next 24 hours (2016-10-18 00:00:00 to 2016-10-18 23:00:00), we would use the values from 2016-10-17 00:00:00 to 2016-10-17 23:00:00? 
        But we don't have that, we have to use the forecast we just made? 

     This would lead to:
        Day 5 (2016-10-17) = Day 4 (2016-10-16)
        Day 6 (2016-10-18) = Day 5 (forecast) = Day 4 -> same as Day 4 again.

     So the entire forecast would be 4 repetitions of the last day?
